name: Rohan Basu Roy
content: Rohan Basu Roy Rohan Basu Roy I am an Assistant Professor (tenure-track) in the Kahlert School of Computing and SCI Institute at the University of Utah. I perform research on scheduling and optimizations on various forms of parallel and distributed computing systems like cloud computing, serverless platforms, and HPC/supercomputing systems. The goal of my research is to improve the productivity, cost-effectiveness, and sustainability of these large-scale systems. The tools and solutions from my works are largely open-sourced, regularly reproduced and used in the systems research community. My works have appeared in several highly competitive systems research venues, in recognition of which I have received the ACM-IEEE CS George Michael Memorial HPC Fellowship, MLCommons ML and Systems Rising Star recognition, and other departmental awards and recognitions. My Ph.D. is in Computer Engineering from Northeastern University Boston, advised by Prof. Devesh Tiwari. I am looking for Ph.D. students, with interest/experience in HPC and Quantum Computation, to join my group in Fall 2026. If you are motivated, please drop me an email and apply to the University of Utah's CS Ph.D. program.
